content: Morning Rohan, welcome back. Hope the jet lag's not too bad. We're set for the post-trip debrief with Advik tomorrow at 09:00 SGT.
Thanks Ruby, still a bit foggy but surprisingly okay. Let's keep tomorrow's slot.
Notedüëç Will send the Zoom link tonight so it's ready in your calendar.
Morning Rohan. Here's the HRV comparison from your recent US trip vs Q1 UK trip. Despite a more demanding schedule, avg HRV was 15% higher. Clear sign of increased resilience.
That's solid. The travel protocol definitely helped.
Exactly. You maintained sleep regularity better this time, fewer HRV dips post-evening events.
Dr. Warren will share the full blood panel later today. I'll ping once it's in.
Excellent news, Rohan. ApoB is now 88 mg/dL - we've crossed the sub-100 threshold and are well on track to hit <80 by Q2.
That's a big milestone. Appreciate the work from everyone üôè
Now that key risk factors are stabilizing, the logical next step in proactive screening is a full-body MRI to establish a baseline for detecting solid tumors early.
Is a full-body MRI really necessary? What about false positives?

It does help in early detection at highly treatable stages. However, incidental findings may trigger follow-up scans. The decision should balance your personal risk tolerance and your desire for maximum foresight.
Since my hs-CRP dropped 40%, does that theoretically lower my baseline cancer risk, making a clean MRI baseline more valuable?
Correct, lower inflammation likely reduces baseline risk. That makes an MRI now a strong 'clean slate' reference for future comparison.
Alright, let's do it.
Understood. I'll research top facilities like Prenuvo, compare protocols, and send you a summary. I'll coordinate scheduling with Sarah.
Quick update: short-listed 3 facilities with advanced MRI protocols. Will send pros/cons doc by EOD.
Perfect. Keep it concise so I can review between calls.
Morning Rohan. While we're ahead on lipids, keep sodium <2g today. Your travel meals bumped avg last week.
Noted. Lunch is grilled chicken salad, no dressing.
Sent MRI comparison doc to your email. Let me know if any criteria matter more than location.
Speed of report turnaround is top. Don't want delays.
Rohan, keep today's movement light - 20 min walk + stretches. Avoid loading legs heavily post-travel.
Will do. Feels like my legs are still in JFK.
Secured your MRI slot at Prenuvo, 4 Nov, 08:30. Sarah confirmed your calendar's updated.
Great work. Thanks for moving quick.
Small anomaly in your sleep score last night (dropped to 76). Any late caffeine?
Espresso at 5pm‚Ä¶ guilty.
Explains it. Let's keep last caffeine intake before 2pm till we stabilise.
Your weekly summary's ready ‚Äî want me to send here or email?
Email's better, I'll file it.
Breakfast idea: avocado + boiled egg on rye. Keeps satiety steady till lunch.
On it. Already had the eggs boiledüëç
Reminder: no food or coffee after 20:00 Sunday before MRI. Hydrate well.
Got it. Will comply.
Easy mobility this morning - open hips, gentle spine twists. Avoid high-intensity.
Done. Nice way to start the weekend.
Looking ahead, this MRI will mark your transition into full longevity planning. Big step.
Feels like it. Thanks for steering the ship.
